definition: to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group

sentences.english: Shortly afterwards admiral harwood learnt that the ship was weighing anchor.
sentences.chinese: 嗣后不久，哈伍德海军上将获悉“施佩”号在起锚了。

sentences.english: Until the time of shiny red glow of the sea, Look at our ships have to anchor.
sentences.chinese: 待到朝霞映红了海面，看我们的战舰又要起锚。

sentences.english: In the morning we weighed anchor and sailed on.
sentences.chinese: 清晨我们起锚继续航行。

sentences.english: They are going to up-anchor tomorrow morning.
sentences.chinese: 他们准备明天早晨起锚。

sentences.english: The same also has one category the electricity control tool and can control to break down or weigh anchor.
sentences.chinese: 同样也有一种类似的电控工具可以控制抛锚或起锚。

sentences.english: The ship was weighting anchor to get away before the falling tide left her stranded.
sentences.chinese: 船正在起锚开动，以免落潮使它搁浅。

sentences.english: Sending signals back to base, unmoored and weightless and no longer marking time.
sentences.chinese: 往基地发送信号，起锚了，失重了，也不用计算时间。

sentences.english: We are installing anchor handling machinery.
sentences.chinese: 我们正在安装起锚设备。

sentences.english: Look! The ship is breaking out.

definition: (of a boat) to reach the shore/to pull toward shore/close to shore/landfall
(of a ship) to set sail/(of an aeroplane) to take off/also written 啟航|启航[qi3 hang2]
